refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This program produces from astrometrically processed input FITS images file, which can be fed to TPoint for model fitting.

refentry.refsect1:
OPTIONS
&optiongnu;
&basicapplist;
-j
Specify into output the information, that raw (physical) mount coordinates are stored in J2000 (unusual and unwanted situation, but some mounts can potentially report it only this way).
-c
Force using computation method for obtaining raw mount RA/DEC coordinates from TEL and MNT_FLIP values; by default we first try to use the direct values U_TEL and fall down to computation when they are not available. The computation method cannot distinguish between geometrically same but physically different positions, so the non-cyclic TP terms (i.e. polynomial) cannot be used.
-p
Specify the reference pixel on image. Should be set to value, defined originally to camera as CRPIX1:CRPIX2. This is recorded in fits header and will be used by default, but processing procedure could potentially change it, so this option allows to define it manually. Available parameter is: "center" or X:Y for particular coordinates on CCD.
